10

Kraft sued for deaths from underage Gillette drinking

A lawsuit claims Gillette Stadium owner Robert Kraft was responsible for a crash that killed two who allegedly drank illegally at the stadium in 2008. (Globe, 5:36 p.m.)
  • 7/27/08 Two women killed, one injured in crash on Rte. 1

Mitt Romney having trouble eluding camera lens as he returns to private life

Coming off his loss in the presidential election, Mitt Romney is trying to transition back to private life, but he keeps popping up on the Internet. (Globe, 6:06 p.m.)

Early holiday commute turns into crawl

With Thanksgiving still two days away, holiday traffic was already clogging the state’s highways this evening with travelers heading out of town. (Globe, 7:33 p.m.)

Dinner companions: A-to-Z guide to sides

A golden, juicy bird looks grand in the center of the Thanksgiving table, but the stars of the feast are often the side dishes. Here are 26 suggestions.

  • Thanksgiving recipes from Boston food bloggers

Israeli strikes kill 3 Palestinian journalists

Israeli airstrikes killed three Palestinian journalists in their cars today, a Gaza health official and the head of the Hamas-run Al Aqsa TV said. (AP, 4:23 p.m.)
  • US, Britain warn of risks of Israeli ground war
  • Pictures Scenes from the conflict in Gaza

Sex-change surgery suspended for killer

Judge Mark Wolf ruled that Michelle Kosilek (left) will not receive a state-funded operation until an appeal of the funding decision. (Globe, 12:16 p.m.)

Hospital room is now
Mayor Menino’s office

For the past 25 days, the mayor has been working from Brigham and Women’s Hospital, where he is being treated for a ­variety of ailments.
Opinion | Dan Shaughnessy

Patriots stay mum on Gronkowski

The tight end had surgery for a broken left forearm . . . we think. It’s not certain because the team refuses to publicly acknowledge that Gronk is hurt.

Highway system, T face big deficits

The MBTA faces a $130 million deficit for the next budget year, but that daunting gap is eclipsed by a $240 million highway system shortfall.
Opinion | Kevin Cullen

The truth never dies

Louie Greco died in prison, an innocent man, because the FBI had no qualms about letting four innocent men take the rap for an informant’s crime.

TV spoilers becoming unavoidable

The obsession with sharing everything we know on Facebook, Twitter, and other social media sites means that what happens on TV doesn’t stay on TV.
Opinion | Farah Stockman

Baby, please don’t go

Talk of secession could be a sign of irreconcilable differences in our relationship to the federal government.

Chicken saves charities’ holiday

Higher prices and growing demand have forced more charity groups to hand out chickens instead of turkeys to struggling families.

Foods that fight heart disease

While losing excess weight, reducing saturated fat in the diet, and partaking in daily physical activity are all key to lowering your risk of heart disease, adding heart-healthy foods to your diet can also help.

Warren B. Rudman dies at 82

Email does Petraeus in
